summary_RS: Electrical and Computer Engineering Ph.D. and founder of the NanoML team at Purdue University developing machine learning algorithms for generative AI, quantum optimization and photonic design. 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 9+ years in algorithm design and analysis.
summary_op: Electrical and Computer Engineering Ph.D. with 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 9+ years in algorithm design and analysis. Leader of a team of 16 data scientists and engineers developing breakthroughs in machine learning assisted optimization algorithms for applications in computational electromagnetics and quantum optics.
summary_web: Machine Learning Ph.D. candidate with 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 8+ years in algorithm design and analysis. Leader of a team of 16 data scientists and engineers, developing breakthroughs in machine learning with applications in generative AI, computer vision, and quantum.
summary_qml: Quantum machine learning Ph.D. candidate and founder of the NanoML team developing machine learning algorithms for quantum generative AI and photonics. 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 8+ years in algorithm design and analysis.
interests: Machine Learning and Generative Modeling for Multiphysics and Design

content.text: Developing generative models and reinforcement learning algorithms for quantum circuit generation with applications in quantum eigensolvers.

Advising AI for Quantum collaboration between Purdue University and Broomfield office for the development of generative AI models for integrated photonics devices. NDAs signed and discussing hiring a full-time PhD student.

Executing a generative AI proposal for building new latent graph diffusion models for quantum circuit synthesis and transpilation, graph optimization for neural architecture search, and QNLP diagram generation.
Contributed to the reliability of lambeq by reworking symbolic library backend and simplifying quantum circuit transpilation.

Published quantum machine learning algorithms for designing meta-optical devices, achieving a 16200% quantum speed-up resulting in a major milestone for the Quantum Science Center with two news articles and 30 citations.
Advising several projects as a visiting researcher for the development of latent optimization and generative AI for quantum photonics application and device design.
Raised $27k in computing resources through grants, saved $40k in ML costs through server maintenance, and assisted in raising $200k+ for the QSC Summer Schools.
Led the development of attention-based models for tackling the $75B counterfeit chip market leading to a 55,000x speed-up and 41% accuracy increase in the verification of semiconductor devices.
Demonstrated comparative advantage on neutral atoms for generative AI sampling of photonic devices.
Set team research objectives and wrote quantum simulation software in Python and Julia to simulate Rydberg atom systems for analysis.
Verified early-access, open-source, flagship neutral atom simulation software Bloqade on machine learning sampling tasks.
Derived optimal UAV routes for search and rescue missions to choose deliveries based on a tradeoff of risk of failure and reward.
Created sweep-covers for partitioning road-networks for multi-UAV routing to capture ground-vehicles.

Engineered verification software in Python, XML, and C++ for ARMv8 instruction set coverage, leading to a 250% improvement in Chi-Square randomness and immediate positive feedback from customers for improving test consistency.
Rebuilt 2 ARMv8 debug instruction tests in ARM's verification suite to reduce the complexity of debugging for customers.
Designed a 32-Bit MIPS RISC processor in Verilog with L1-Cache and 5-stage pipeline. Compiled C to MIPS IS and benchmarked on FPGAs.
Developed Python to RISCV transpiler for generating Verilog Read-Only-Memory for RISCV-based System-on-Chip.
